data.question: Did the oxidation state of molybdenum remain +6 after the reaction according to XPS measurements?
What was the crystal system of Mo-NU-1200 after catalysis without TEA?

What was the effect of TEA on the catalytic activity of Mo-NU-1200?
data.answer: The presence of TEA inhibited the catalytic activity of the oxidation reaction.

data.question: Was the Mo-NU-1200 catalyst recycled and reused in the study?
What was the role of the linker TMTB in the synthesis of NU-1200?
data.answer: The linker TMTB was used in the synthesis of NU-1200 to form the framework.

data.question: Did the Mo-NU-1200 catalyst retain its metal loading after recovery from base and base-free reaction conditions?
What was the crystallographic observation of Mo-NU-1200 after catalysis with TEA?
data.answer: The pristine Mo1 coordination mode of molybdenum species completely evolved into the pristine Mo2 anchoring mode on the Zr node.

data.question: Was the crystallinity of Mo-NU-1200 affected by the addition of TEA into the reaction solution?
data.answer: The addition of TEA into the reaction solution had no effect on the MOF crystallinity.
